lexUnit.name: ford.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cross a stream at a shallow place

sentence.text: Here you need to ford the River Esk -- it 's normally only inches deep -- and head for a waterfall , Cam Spout ( north , 0.5 mile ) .
We forded the Webi Shebeli on 17 October and camped near an Arussi village .
Before I move on I note that I could have fished the swim from the other bank , although there was no shallow-enough water nearby to ford the river .
In 1072 William led a large army up to Stirling , forded the river there , and rode on to join up with his fleet entering the Tay .
The king himself had forged ahead and reaching a flooded stream , had been the first to ford it , forcing the army to follow him .
Climb over the fence , ford the burn again to reach the main road .
` Could we not travel safely on the road now ? " she asked cautiously , as they forded yet another stream .

` I 'd like to ford the river before dark if it wo n't inconvenience your ladyship too greatly . "

If I could find the River , I could ford it somehow , thought Fergus , his mind tumbling now with ideas and plans , and with half-forgotten memories .

Meanwhile , rescue workers searched for an 18-year-old woman who was presumed dead after she tried to ford a creek in her car .
In Santa Barbara County , surging floodwaters killed a 60-year-old man and an 18-year-old woman who tried to ford a creek Friday .
